page.title: 01Farming Woodland Brightling
page.content: Undulating hillsrising to a height of 546ft at Brightling Needle, all of nineteenth century MP Jack Fuller's six follies, decard highest point is East Sussex, comprising of farming, cereal (oats, wheat and silage) cattle and sheep. Within the area is a large resevoir and all of the country's Gypsum mines, a feature of the landscape /being the carefully concealed 3\ mile ground level conveyor belt (first in England) carrying gypsum back to the nearby factory. The area includes a small village of Fush under 300 inhabitants in three concentrated areas. Intee Village, a medieval clouds with three worst famous of Fuller's follies, his own pyramid shaped mansuleum, a public house named able lius, a postoffice/village store and stables.
